RegionLength.name: Descriptor region length
RegionLength.help_text: If non-zero, specifies the length of the Descriptor region.

NumComponents.name: Number of Flash Components
NumComponents.help_text: Number Of Components (NC). This field identifies the total number of Flash Components. Each supported Flash Component requires a separate chip select. 00 = 1 Component and GPIO58 defaults as GPO. 01 = 2 Components and GPIO58 defaults as native functionality, SPI_CS1#.

ComponentBaseAddr.name: Component Base Address
ComponentBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Component portion of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionBaseAddr.name: Region base address
RegionBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Region Base Address (FRBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Region portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0.

NumMasters.name: Number of Masters
NumMasters.help_text: Number Of Masters (NM). This field identifies the total number of Flash Regions. This number is 0's based.

MasterBaseAddr.name: Master base address
MasterBaseAddr.help_text: Identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor.

IchStrapLength.name: Number of ICH straps
IchStrapLength.help_text: ICH Strap Length (ISL). Identifies the 1s based number of Dwords of ICH Straps to be read, up to 255 DWs (1KB) max. A setting of all 0's indicates there are no ICH DW straps.

IchBaseAddr.name: ICH straps base address
IchBaseAddr.help_text: Flash ICH Strap Base Address (FISBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the ICH Strap portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. For validation purposes, the recommended FISBA is 0x10.

MchStrapLength.name: Number of MCH straps
MchStrapLength.help_text: The number of MCH straps to be read. Valid values are 0 to 255.

MchBaseAddr.name: MCH straps base address
MchBaseAddr.help_text: Flash Master Base Address (FMBA). This identifies address bits [11:4] for the Master portion of the Flash Descriptor. Bits [24:12] and bits [3:0] are 0. A recommended FMBA is 06h.

ReadStatusFreq.name: Read ID and Read Status clock frequency
ReadStatusFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

WriteEraseFreq.name: Write and erase clock frequency
WriteEraseFreq.help_text: If more that one Flash component exists, this field must be the lowest common frequency of the different components.

FastReadFreq.name: Fast read clock frequency
FastReadFreq.help_text: This field is undefined if the Fast Read Support is set to false.

DensityComp1.name: Flash component 1 density
DensityComp1.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component.

DensityComp2.name: Flash component 2 density
DensityComp2.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component.

InvalidInst0.name: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInst0.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst1.name: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInst1.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst2.name: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInst2.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

InvalidInst3.name: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInst3.help_text: Op-code for an invalid instruction that the Flash Controller should protect against chip erase. This byte should be set to 0 if there is no instruction to protect against.

FlashPartitionBndry.name: Flash Partition Boundary
FlashPartitionBndry.help_text: The FPBA build settings are configurable in Build -> Build Settings.

LowerFlashEraseSize.name: Lower Flash Erase Size
LowerFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the lower of the two erase sizes.

UpperFlashEraseSize.name: Upper Flash Erase Size
UpperFlashEraseSize.help_text: For Asymmetric flash parts, this is the upper of the two erase sizes.

ReadAccess.name: Read access
ReadAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr1[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write access
WriteAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr1[31:24]

ReadAccess.name: Read access
ReadAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr2[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write access
WriteAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr2[31:24]

ReadAccess.name: Read access
ReadAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, read access is granted. Flmstr3[23:16]

WriteAccess.name: Write access
WriteAccess.help_text: Each bit corresponds to Regions [7:0]. If the bit is set, write access is granted. Flmstr3[31:24]

DmiReqIdDisable.name: DMI RequesterID Security Check Disable
DmiReqIdDisable.help_text: false = DMI RequesterID Security Checks are enabled. true = DMI RequesterID Security Checks are disabled and no Requester ID checking is done on accesses from DMI. The primary purpose of this strap is to support server environments with multiple CPU's that each have a different RequesterID that can each access the Flash.

MeSmBus2Sel.name: SmBus 2 Select
MeSmBus2Sel.help_text: Specifies whether the ME SmBus Controller 2 is connected to the SmBus pins or the SmLink pins.

IntegratedGbeOrPcieSel.name: Integrated GbE or PCI Express select
IntegratedGbeOrPcieSel.help_text: Defines what PCIe Port 6 is used for.

BmcMode.name: BmcMode
BmcMode.help_text: If true, device is in BMC mode. If IntelÂ® AMT or ASF2 using Intel integrated LAN then this should be false.

MeSmBus2Sel.name: SmBus 2 Select
MeSmBus2Sel.help_text: Specifies whether the ME SmBus Controller 2 is connected to the SmBus pins or the SmLink pins.

TcoMode.value: Advanced TCO Mode (TCO Slave is muxed into SMBus pins)
TcoMode.value_list: Advanced TCO Mode (TCO Slave is muxed into SMBus pins),,Legacy/Compatible Mode (TCO Slave is muxed into SMLink pins)
TcoMode.name: TCO Mode
TcoMode.help_text: Sets the value in SMBus TCO Mode register in SmBus Auxillary Status.

TripPointSelect.name: Trip Point Select
TripPointSelect.help_text: false the NJCLK input puffer is matched to 3.3v signal from the external PHY device. true it is matched to 1.8v.

MeDisable.name: ME disable
MeDisable.help_text: If true, ME is disabled. This will automatically be set false when ME region data is specified.

CPUPWRGDtoRSTDis.name: CPU PWRGD-to-RST# WD Timer Disable
CPUPWRGDtoRSTDis.help_text: false - The ICH enables the CPUPWRGD-to-CPURST# rising edge watchdog timer. true - The ICH disables the CPUPWRGD-to-CPURST# rising edge watchdog timer.

CPUPWRGDStretchDis.name: CPU PWRGD Stretching WD Timer Disable
CPUPWRGDStretchDis.help_text: false - The ICH enables the CPUPWRGD Deassertion Stretching watchdog timer. true - The ICH disables the CPUPWRGD Deassertion Stretching watchdog timer.

DmiReqIdDisable.name: DMI RequesterID Security Check Disable
DmiReqIdDisable.help_text: false = DMI RequesterID Security Checks are enabled. true = DMI RequesterID Security Checks are disabled and no Requester ID checking is done on accesses from DMI. The primary purpose of this strap is to support server environments with multiple CPU's that each have a different RequesterID that can each access the Flash.

LanPhyPcGp12Sel.name: LANPHYPC_GP12_SEL
LanPhyPcGp12Sel.help_text: Set to 0 for GP12 to be used as GPIO (General Purpose Input/Output), or 1 for GP12 to be used for native mode as LAN_PHYPC for 82566 LCD device

IntegratedGbeOrPcieSel.name: Integrated GbE or PCI Express select
IntegratedGbeOrPcieSel.help_text: Defines what PCIe Port 6 is used for.

TcoModeSlave.value_list: Connected to SMBus Pins,,Connected to SMLink Pins
TcoModeSlave.name: TCO Slave Select
TcoModeSlave.help_text: Configures whether TCO Slave is connected to SMBus or SMLink pins.

CLinkVrefSelect.name: CLINK Vref Select
CLinkVrefSelect.help_text: false - Use the Internal CLink Vref (default). true - Use External CLink Vref.

DmiRxEscVoltage.name: DMI Rx ESD Bias Voltage Default
DmiRxEscVoltage.help_text: This soft strap controls the default value of register 2010[1] in RCBA space

DmiForceDetect.value_list: 00b (Do not force detect),,01b (Force DMI to x4 link),,10b (Force DMI to x2 link),,11b (Reserved)
DmiForceDetect.name: DMI Force Detect
DmiForceDetect.help_text: Sets the strapping options to force the DMI link to be always detected as either a x2 or a x4 link depending upon the soft strap setting.

SMT1Select.value_list: Disconnected,,Reserved,,Connected to SMBus Pins,,Connected to SMLink Pins
SMT1Select.name: SMT1 Select
SMT1Select.help_text: Configures whether SMT1 is connected to SMBus or SMLink pins.

SMT1Freq.name: SMT1 Frequency
SMT1Freq.help_text: The value of these bits determine the physical bus speed supported by the HW.

SMT2Select.value_list: Disconnected,,Reserved,,Connected to SMBus Pins,,Connected to SMLink Pins
SMT2Select.name: SMT2 Select
SMT2Select.help_text: Configures whether SMT2 is connected to SMBus or SMLink pins.

SMT2Freq.name: SMT2 Frequency
SMT2Freq.help_text: The value of these bits determine the physical bus speed supported by the HW.

MeDisable.name: ME disable
MeDisable.help_text: If true, ME is disabled. This will automatically be set false when ME region data is specified.

AuxWellSelect.name: Auxiliary Well Select
AuxWellSelect.help_text: 0: Platforms connecting AUX well to Suspend well. 1: Platforms connecting AUX well to Core well. 2: Platforms which control AUX power.

NorthMLinkClockDis.name: North MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
NorthMLinkClockDis.help_text: false = North MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = North MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the dafault value of the North MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable registers.

SouthMLinkClockEn.name: South MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
SouthMLinkClockEn.help_text: false = South MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = South MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value of the South MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable registers.

MeSmBusDynClockEn.name: ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
MeSmBusDynClockEn.help_text: false = ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value for the ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gate Enable for both ME SmBus Controllers.

SstDynClockEn.name: SST Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
SstDynClockEn.help_text: false = SST Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = SST Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value for the SST Clock Gate Enable registers.

NorthMLink2NonPostedEn.name: North MLINK 2 Non-Posted Enable
NorthMLink2NonPostedEn.help_text: false = North MLink supports one downstream non-posted request. true = North MLink supports two downstream non-posted requests.

NorthMLinkClockDis.name: North MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
NorthMLinkClockDis.help_text: false = North MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = North MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the dafault value of the North MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable registers.

SouthMLinkClockEn.name: South MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
SouthMLinkClockEn.help_text: false = South MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = South MLink Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value of the South MLink Dynamic Clock Gate Enable registers.

MeSmBusDynClockEn.name: ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
MeSmBusDynClockEn.help_text: false = ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value for the ME SmBus Dynamic Clock Gate Enable for both ME SmBus Controllers.

SstDynClockEn.name: SST Dynamic Clock Gate Enable
SstDynClockEn.help_text: false = SST Dynamic Clock Gating is disabled. true = SST Dynamic Clock Gating is enabled (default). Sets the default value for the SST Clock Gate Enable registers.

NorthMLink2NonPostedEn.name: North MLINK 2 Non-Posted Enable
NorthMLink2NonPostedEn.help_text: false = North MLink supports one downstream non-posted request. true = North MLink supports two downstream non-posted requests.

IchDanburyEn.name: ICH Danbury Enable
IchDanburyEn.help_text: false = Danbury is disabled. true = Danbury is enabled. Allows for indicating that Danbury feature is enabled.

Smt1GpAddrEn.name: SMT1 GP Address Enable
Smt1GpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt1AsdAddrEn.name: SMT1 ASD Address Enable
Smt1AsdAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt1MctpAddrEn.name: SMT1 MCTP Address Enable
Smt1MctpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt1I2cAddrEn.name: SMT1 I2C Address Enable
Smt1I2cAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt2GpAddrEn.name: SMT2 GP Address Enable
Smt2GpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt2AsdAddrEn.name: SMT2 ASD Address Enable
Smt2AsdAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt2MctpAddrEn.name: SMT2 MCTP Address Enable
Smt2MctpAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt2I2cAddrEn.name: SMT2 I2C Address Enable
Smt2I2cAddrEn.help_text: true: Address is enabled. false: Address is disabled.

Smt1SubVidDid4ASF.name: SMT1 Subsystem Vendor and Device ID for ASF2
Smt1SubVidDid4ASF.help_text: [15:0]-Subsystem Vendor ID, [31:16]-Subsystem Device ID. The values are provided as bytes 8-9 and 10-11 of the data payload to an external master when it initiates a Directed GET UDID Block Read Command to the ME-SMT1 controller's ASF2 address.

Smt2SubVidDid4ASF.name: SMT2 Subsystem Vendor and Device ID for ASF2
Smt2SubVidDid4ASF.help_text: [15:0]-Subsystem Vendor ID, [31:16]-Subsystem Device ID. The values are provided as bytes 8-9 and 10-11 of the data payload to an external master when it initiates a Directed GET UDID Block Read Command to the ME-SMT2 controller's ASF2 address.

PCIePortConf1.value_list: 4x1 Ports 1-4 (x1),,1x2, 2x1Port 1 (x2), Port 2 (disabled), Ports 3, 4 (x1),,2x2 Port 1 (x2), Port 3 (x2), Ports 2, 4 (disabled),,1x4 Port 1 (x4), Ports 2-4 (disabled)
PCIePortConf1.name: PCIe Port Configuration 1
PCIePortConf1.help_text: These straps set the default value of PCIe Port Configuration 1 register covering PCIe ports 1-4.

PCIePortConf2.name: PCIe Port Configuration 2
PCIePortConf2.help_text: These straps set the default value of the PCIe Port Configuration 2 register covering PCIe ports 5-6. For ICH10, PCIEPCS2[1] is not used as there are no ports 7-8.

PCIeLaneReversal1.name: PCIe Lane Reversal 1
PCIeLaneReversal1.help_text: Sets the default value for the PCIe Port 1, Device 28 Function 0, offset D8[27] register. When false, PCIe Lanes 0-3 are Reversed (for Port 1 when configured as a 1x4). This register has a default value of true (1) (no lane reversal) to maintain polarity with the hard strap that it replaced.

iTPMDisable.name: IntelÂ® TPM Disable
iTPMDisable.help_text: When set true, IntelÂ® TPM Host Interface is disabled and all IntelÂ® TPM cycles are forwarded to the LPC bus. When set false, IntelÂ® TPM is enabled.

VeEnableDisable.name: VE Enable
VeEnableDisable.help_text: Indicates whether VE is enabled or disabled. If false (disabled), ME will not fetch VE code from Firmware.

VeCodeAuthDis.name: VE Code Authentication Disable
VeCodeAuthDis.help_text: Indicates if VE code is signed and should be authenticated.

VeFwInHdd.name: VE Firmware in HDD
VeFwInHdd.help_text: This bit indicates where the VE firmware is located. True indicates that VE firmware is located in HDD as part of VE descriptor data (VDD). In this case VE ROM code will send the VE code image to ME UMA for authentication purposes. False indicates that VE firmware is located in flash and ME is responsible for copying the code from flash to SRAM.

SpiFingerprint.name: SPI Fingerprint Sensor Present
SpiFingerprint.help_text: Indicates if an SPI Fingerprint sensor is present at CS#1.

iTPMDisable.name: IntelÂ® TPM Disable
iTPMDisable.help_text: When set true, IntelÂ® TPM Host Interface is disabled and all IntelÂ® TPM cycles are forwarded to the LPC bus. When set false, IntelÂ® TPM is enabled.

VeEnableDisable.name: VE Enable
VeEnableDisable.help_text: Indicates whether VE is enabled or disabled. If false (disabled), ME will not fetch VE code from Firmware.

VeCodeAuthDis.name: VE Code Authentication Disable
VeCodeAuthDis.help_text: Indicates if VE code is signed and should be authenticated.

VeFwInHdd.name: VE Firmware in HDD
VeFwInHdd.help_text: This bit indicates where the VE firmware is located. True indicates that VE firmware is located in HDD as part of VE descriptor data (VDD). In this case VE ROM code will send the VE code image to ME UMA for authentication purposes. False indicates that VE firmware is located in flash and ME is responsible for copying the code from flash to SRAM.

SpiFingerprint.name: SPI Fingerprint Sensor Present
SpiFingerprint.help_text: Indicates if an SPI Fingerprint sensor is present at CS#1.

MeAuxDisable.name: ME Alternate Disable
MeAuxDisable.help_text: Setting this bit allows ME to perform critical chipset functions but prevents loading of any ME FW applications. For more details, please refer to Bringup guide.

MeDisable.name: ME disable
MeDisable.help_text: If true, ME is disabled. This will automatically be set false when ME region data is specified.

InputFile.name: Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: The contents of this file (up to 256 bytes) are copied directly into the OEM section of the Flash Descriptor.

RegionLength.name: BIOS region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the BIOS region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the BIOS image binary that will be copied into this region.

RegionLength.name: GbE LAN region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the GbE LAN region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the Gbe image binary that will be copied into this region.

RegionLength.name: PDR region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the PDR region in bytes. Set this to zero and specify an input file if you want to tool to determing the appropriate size for the region.

InputFile.name: Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the PDR image binary that will be copied into this region.

InputFile.name: Binary input file
InputFile.help_text: This is the path to a binary file that will be used for the partitions contents.

QstConfigurationFile.name: IntelÂ® QST config file
QstConfigurationFile.help_text: This is the IntelÂ® Quiet System Technology (QST) configuration binary file.

PermitFile.name: Permit file
PermitFile.help_text: Adds the permit data to the Datastore.

RegionOffset.name: Region Offset
RegionOffset.help_text: The offset from the beginning of flash where the ME region will start. If 0, then ftool will determine where to put it based on the region order.

RegionLength.name: ME region length
RegionLength.help_text: This is the size of the ME region in bytes. Set this to 0 to make the region length equal to the binary file length (rounded up to 4k). Extra space will be filled with 0xFF.

InputFile.name: Text file
InputFile.help_text: This is the path to a text file that will be used for the configuration paramters.
